98FFFB5F11A54C799533655EF1A08B30.description: Apply strategies and criteria for choosing repertoire.

EA04C970DB094A3590A19044E6AB8F2C.description: Examine characteristics of guitar role models.

1A25ABA68F3340F0AA848A22460C7604.description: Participate in class rehearsal discussions when problem solving.

3E01AC6D6D7A45F8A284E2A915A7E532.description: Demonstrate leadership as a guitar player (e.g., offering help and guidance to other guitar players in class, being prepared for class).

8F74547F5CB7434FBD149DEC44CE9260.description: Create and use own practice plan to improve and prepare for rehearsal.

D97EA8A5085341E9BD3561B139BA2B90.description: Analyze, independently, the characteristics of a responsible band member.

D27B1106ADDF48FA8B751FBCE2DAA3CF.description: Play in time with other guitar players.

29BA810A6CE24FD788B487399434E62B.description: Apply, independently, the skills, techniques and attitudes necessary for successful group performances.

1F062700BB3F49A0992A67729E6D3CB8.description: Analyze live and recordedFirst Nations and Métis guitar performances.

37CCCC00C4C549FC93EC3C5605BF5B92.description: Analyze the characteristics of guitar playing in First Nationsand Métis music.

17692EE1F02A4E84976BAC44854FB638.description: Use, independently, musical terminology when describing guitar playing of self and others (e.g., using the elements ofmusic to describe the guitar playing).

842B3E0DC9844BA38F2C8F7116CBED02.description: Examine the music of contemporary SaskatchewanFirst Nations and Métis guitar players and songwriters.

EA4295F19F304057981178B4D3FB2815.description: Listen to and analyze ways the guitar is used in contemporary Saskatchewan First Nations and Métis music.

15742B9EAD0240A8AEC7F9FD3797D0AD.description: Engage with a mentor to make improvements to personal practice plans.

0A79D7EBB7504D20AE4418D9FFEB67F8.description: Research the practice routines of accomplished guitar players.

17E87308F9D14CCC98A69BF997A30AF5.description: Establish one’s own guitar goals and apply the steps necessary to achieve those goals.

31096225DB97407D86B9848BAC8D998E.description: Evaluate, refine and continue with one’s own practice plan.

1A08C4B940034F4EAE8345AFE97A5137.description: Plan the required steps to achieving one’s personal guitar goals.

FC9A625835F447F6B35BA818FF4867BD.description: Discuss the elements of effective planning for personal guitar playing growth.

5A5AB8EA8F7C4D568872CF21E6BE2D9C.description: Identify resources (e.g., apps, practice trackers, games, motivation, lessons) to support practice plans.

A347120376244051A0EE14D082829258.description: Identify potential obstacles to practicing and brainstorm possible solutions.

D2148ACB141D4E69BF3236E5F8E30CE9.description: Create a personal inventory to investigate the impact and role of music in one’s own life.

97BBAA8B15314A7F8F0DC8575C4F4A68.description: Design, implement and evaluate, with peer guidance or independently, a personal practice plan.

D95D7A2B32734257A17E0257E2406600.description: Critique live and recorded guitar performances.

91CCAFB889E8400595090F6FA056ED07.description: Generate, independently, criteria of effective guitar playing in a group or pair.

BF7AD05461BC41A58BF210F5B76092C3.description: Examine music using ear training (e.g., finding keys, strumming patterns, rhythms).

0AB4E0A414B340F5B6740233EC542075.description: Analyze characteristics of an accomplished guitar player.

32DA8FA6856242B8A559526D12C76BD0.description: Identify the chords in a song using the harmonized scale.

9CDAAE0D320B460BADCFFBFD1F6B7225.description: Use, independently, musical terminology when describing guitar playing of self and others (e.g., using the elements of music to describe the guitar playing).

B2A5E28C147B40718B8365714B5EB0EA.description: Analyze characteristics and techniques of various genres (e.g., rock, country, pop, hip hop).

24B49C9F7D2B48EF84ABDFFA2323569D.description: Listen to and critique, independently, the guitar playing of self and others.

AC2F11EBF133487D8BD939E1A5979265.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian and International artists using critical thinking, research, creativity and collaborative inquiry.

00FC4C49DC6145568B45C6F6A5FDDF6F.description: Analyze the impact for producers and consumers regarding the evolution in how guitar music is shared throughout history.

6E4734AD8CCB4E9C90663B343B2E24A4.description: Explore opportunities for engagement in music activities, events and concerts in own community (e.g., participate in artists in school projects or work study experiences with professional associations, provincial and community arts and cultural organizations, independent study mentorships with individual musicians, groups or recording studios).

4CF6F805C29B4D3F98F13D16A0DFF1F3.description: Examine how music is infused in daily life (e.g., to influence consumers via advertising, shopping environments) including media (e.g., film, video games, television, social media, apps).

47DF1941E15B493DAD27DFAC9BEE7ECF.description: Explain the ways that different genres/styles of music influence one’s wellbeing (e.g., mood, anxiety, sense of peace).

D47DFEBCAC854E2C8B95CF66EDC17D8E.description: Analyze relationships between music and personal wellness including mental health (e.g., music therapy, social connection) and identify and discuss associated research.

D39DCDC7CF964A43ACD1BDF38A351819.description: Analyze the impact and role of guitar playing in personal life and consider and plan for music careers or pathways for continuing engagement in music.

15839E6988274F76A02A79B78B3F06E4.description: Analyze Canadian Indigenous artists whose contemporary guitar music is influenced by traditional Indigenous music.

ABFD59B98F3D408CB5232B384EB22009.description: Study with local, Canadian or international guitar players to examine their work and careers and to improve one’s own practice.

006BC1220F2946A0B2AEAFC0EE2B5DBB.description: Conduct an inquiry to recommend influential local, Canadian and international guitar players to whom others should listen.

3FA1132E01C14313A5862F8F972E97A6.description: Explain how guitar players influence and respond to social, political and cultural issues (e.g., world music, music concerned with human rights, environmental sustainability).

CC960BEBF6E3415DAAE926AC1CEF65F1.description: Analyze why notable guitar players and their work are/were influential.

001D4572BF534BBE8D041BB0073A4A1F.description: Critique the work of guitar players who have made an impact on music.

0774CA5E61CF41A2B1D72ACF6B1984E5.description: Evaluate the work of acclaimed local, Canadian and international guitar players

A7B32BBD65ED4EB58F76F1D2C474B4FC.description: Examine the evolution of the guitar as an instrument and its associated music considering the style, place and time period.

20126ED5520941ADBB1EAE4756713A76.description: Demonstrate particular genres of music in a stylistically appropriate manner (e.g., genres and styles such as rock, blues, country, bluegrass, folk, jazz, classical, fingerstyle, metal, Hawaiian slack key, Celtic, surf, funk, flamenco, r&b/soul, reggae/ska, Brazilian).

18AB4E478B414F0D9B16C118FE60325A.description: Classify guitar music expressions from a variety of cultures and periods throughout history

BD1E2471844E468A8E0639719E4C0AFF.description: Investigate historical information from a variety of cultural and historical contexts.

000D1AE977AA4EA5A408B7FF60629F44.description: Interpret traditional and contemporary guitar music selections

C1167FC7E70145448F10CA58B19F2D03.description: Examine and play guitar music from a variety of cultural and historical contexts.

CC78BC93F2F54F538CA532302685D28F.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical and contemporary contexts and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

018ED42B86D44154B0B312B6DEC1E577.description: Examine chord structures and experiment with creation of own fingerings.

BFF8FE866D0546B7BC728D16CB8766AA.description: Use music symbols in communicating and expressing musical ideas (e.g., bar line, repeat dots, treble clef).

61258EECE3B8485BA84C75069ACD6FB3.description: Use aural skills to identify the beginner rhythmic patterns in 7/4 time.

A31B2DA357F74B47B53725764A55EA72.description: Explain time signature and how to count and play in 4/4, 3/4 and 6/8 and 7/4 time signature.

82449CBC6B0443B68C66F51316066AB3.description: Use the elements of music (e.g., dynamics, form, harmony, melody, rhythm, texture, timbre, tonality) and aural skills to create expressive performances.

AC6BAEBE19FC424E9AF9F6F7C9E33B18.description: Apply knowledge of music theory and demonstrate aural skills for musical expression.

14C2F603B2954DE1AAD1359E9387A893.description: Read standard notation to play advanced single note pieces or chords.

01EAB9ADF8454B29BEA6EC3C0ECFA655.description: Play in three or more time signatures (e.g., 4/4, 3/4, 6/8, 5/4 and 7/8 time signatures).

C87DD208464A40F283C5D684C20EFF99.description: Play advanced bass riffs or guitar licks.

6DCD988AFAB24CD18AC92EDC32BAB50F.description: Play single or multi note, 8+ line tablature.

C54154083D1C40B18FADB0DA0913EC96.description: Play pieces using 8+ chords with a changing chord progression.

AD22FD13165C4D2FA749108E4F7AC191.description: Play advanced strumming patterns using basic chords.

38367565C3C744C5834AAD11209DB997.description: Apply, consistently, knowledge of musical notation in order to interpret and express musical ideas.

B36DD860698D42628AEB28E10C4BFEF1.description: Play in a group, through shared recorded tracks.

52FEBB6EDEDB4110AB7DDBF67C5A4CDD.description: Begin to develop personal style in own guitar playing.

A6581BC9A73E4585B7E4DEC7DFBA89C9.description: Play 12 or more measure riffs, solos or guitar licks.

7B943E221A624ECA8660650D7A04C68E.description: Practise and play advanced warm-up exercises.

A0F36B051DE143F388AAE961F8D44F78.description: Compose a full piece using chord progressions, fingerstyle techniques or a combination of both.

029DE6D68104470EA83D7445AEFFFC3E.description: Compose a simple piece focusing on song form (e.g., verse/chorus, verse/chorus/bridge).

EB4BEF5E4F9140048642DD71DD669F66.description: Improvise 8+ measure solos, phrases or chord progressions.

29A2BAFE52C34D0C9C7A1FDF44A18376.description: Demonstrate fingerstyle techniques while playing multiple note melodies and arpeggios.

A9FD15CED45A478490A3597EC155077D.description: Identify and play a major scale using three patterns.

8AA0F5B83F884832BB55AE1C06AA7174.description: Play or arrange pieces using 8 or more chords.

413424C674D344C2B742DBBBECDCB6D6.description: Apply understanding of advanced guitar techniques to create and play a musical product.

AB7890E8FC5744F5AE3805150837FA59.description: Record and layer multipletracks from multiple players, using available recording technology (e.g., phones, tablets, laptops).

CA2041206F57428AAC1D798F621B3162.description: Examine the construction of guitar building.

6A77E206B4CA4E60A484225D4FF64490.description: Practice with a metronomeor electric drum beat.

0D7EDFA211E641DFBC3576EE69592C6C.description: Adapt approaches for playing different styles of guitars.

A7A92883DEEC470CAF4BA18F4D8C3D72.description: Select accessories to play in different styles (e.g., select strings for music style).

E66D125220684FE9B98B39F65DB61E00.description: Use an amplifier with basic settings and a pedal or other digital effect, using an electricor acoustic/electric guitar.

79246A2004E84A8EB9DF8C761C7085B9.description: Change the guitar strings onan acoustic and/or electric guitar.

1BFB622BAF304AAD8178EB7F902BFF23.description: Demonstrate, read and transcribe proper finger position (e.g., second and fifth position) on the frets for open chords and single note playing.

BB5789B946D34B74BCC5F0171C7E18C8.description: Apply, independently, knowledge of guitar set up, styles of guitars, maintenance, finger positions and accessories.

EE78CB62DD364FD58F51B36424FDDA44.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
